title: First Website
description: The first site I ever built while still in school. A humble beginning!

title: Industrial Weighing Software
description: At Mettler Toledo, developed custom weighing software using C# and .NET frameworks. Learned software deployment and integration across various technologies.

title: DMCEC Website
description: Built the Decatur Morgan County Entrepreneurial Center website with integrated calendar, email, and custom graphics using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: Original Website for Kickin & Screenin
description: Built the original website for Kickin & Screenin using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: Kickin & Screenin Internal Quote Tool
description: Built a simple internal quote tool for Kickin & Screenin to help with the quoting process. It was a simple tool that allowed us to quote jobs quickly and easily.

title: Avery Marie Maternity
description: Built a complete eCommerce solution with automated messaging and shipping using Ecwid eCommerce and GoDaddy Hosting.

title: Recipe Randomizer App
description: This was my first real application that I built using Svelte.js and SvelteKit. It was a recipe randomizer that would take a users book of recipes and build arandomized menu formy wife to cook for our family. It was a fun project and I learned a lot, but like a lot of side projects it was never finished... ðŸ¤”

title: Hunny & Babe Company Website
description: Built a website for the Hunny & Babe Company to help market their products. It was a simple eCommerce website built using Svelte.js and SvelteKit, and BigCommerce for the eCommerce platform.

title: Beach For House Website
description: Built a website for Thomas Beach for his run for South Carolina House or Representatives. Integrated his campaign and donations links and appliactions to allow online giving.

title: NASA Image of the Day Viewing App
description: Built a simple app using NASA's API to view the daily image of the day. This application was built using Svelte.js and SvelteKit, it was a real turning point in my web development journey.

title: The Year I Discovered Blockchain and Web3
description: I started learning about blockchain and web3 in 2022. I was fascinated by the potential of the technology and the ability to create decentralized applications. I started learning about Solidity and Ethereum and quickly realized that this was something I wanted to be a part of. I started learning about the different blockchains and the different use cases for each one. I spent a lot of time in the DeFi space, and discovered a whole new passion. Trading and Crypto!

title: Trading Bots Consumed My Life
description: I started building trading bots in 2022. I was fascinated by the potential of the technology and the ability to create decentralized applications. Building out automated trading strategies using TradingView and PineScript, to automate the backtesting and eventually the trading. I slowly lost interest in Web3 and started solidifying my skills in trading.

title: Trading Became My Passion
description: Pivoting from trading bots to manual trading changed my outlook on the markets. I started to notice patterns and this led me to start trading on my own. I became a member of the Pack Trade Group, this is where I learned to trade using data and statistics. Changing my trading strategy to a more data-driven approach was a game changer for me. I started to see the markets in a whole new way and I was able to make much better decisions along with implementing risk managment strategies to protect capital as well.

title: Kickin & Screenin Website Redesign and eCommerce Platform Migration
description: Redesigned the website for Kickin & Screenin using Svelte.js and SvelteKit, and Ecwid for the eCommerce platform.

title: Building Trading Tools
description: I have recently started building trading tools to help me become a better trader. The goal is to market these tools once they are complete, if they can help me then they can help other traders as well.

title: Kickin & Screenin Website Redesign #2
description: Redesigned the website for Kickin & Screenin again using the same technology stack as the first redesign. Just a few changes to the design and a few changes to the functionality.

title: Trade Arsenal Webapp
description: Built a webapp to help me manage my trading. It is a simple webapp that allowed me to perform in depth backtesting, track my trades, and see my performance. It was built using Svelte.js and SvelteKit, and Turso for the database.

title: Alabama Reloader Website with Hosted Merch Store Integration
description: Built a website for Alabama Reloader to help market their products. It has a user backend for the owner to update images, colors, change the text, and add blog posts and links all from inside his own custom login page. It also has a hosted merch store integration with Ecwid, with Kickin & Screenin as his fullfilment service.

title: Collab Ads Platform (Paused for now)
description: Built a platform to help me manage and setup collaborative physical media mailer ads. It is a simple platform that allows me to create, manage, and track my collab ads. It was built using Svelte.js and SvelteKit, and SQlite for the database. I paused this project for now as I was not getting the results/response I was hoping for.

title: NCA Tree Software - Demo App
description: Built a demo app for the National Cemetery Administration to try and secure a contract to help them manage their tree inventory. Can't give away the details on this one as I am still hoping to secure the contract.

title: Top Tier Auto Mobile Detailing Website
description: Built a website for Top Tier Auto Mobile Detailing service company to help with their professional online presence. We knocked this one out of the park with design and functionality.

title: SAM Contract WebScraper InternalTool
description: Built a simple internal tool to help me scrape the SAM contract website to help me find contracts that I can bid on. It scrapes the website, filters the data, saves the data to a database, and then sends me notification emails when new contracts are found.
